gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਸਤਿ ਰਿਦੈ ਸਤਿਰੂਪ ਦੇਖੇ ਦ੍ਰਿਗ ਸਤਿਨਾਮ ਜਿਹਬਾ ਕੈ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਰਸ ਪਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gurmati Sati Ridai Satiroop Daykhay Driga , Satinaam Jihabaa Kai Praym Ras Paaay Hai ?
translation: By lodging the teachings of the True Guru in the heart, the eyes of the Sikh of the Guru sees the True Lord pervading in everyone everywhere. He repeats the name of the Lord incessantly and relishes the loving nectar of Naam Simran all the time.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਸਤਿ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਨਾਦ ਨਾਸਕਾ ਸੁਗੰਧਿ ਸਤਿ ਅਾਘ੍ਰਨ ਅਘਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Bibayk Sati Sravan Surati Naada , Naasakaa Sougandhi Sati Aaghran Aghaaay Hai ?
translation: Having listened to the true words of wisdom from the Guru, the ears of a disciple remain engrossed in listening to that tune. Smelling the fragrance of the Naam, his nostrils are satiated by the sweet smell of the Naam.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਤ ਚਰਨਾਮ੍ਰਤ ਹਸਤ ਅਵਲੰਬ ਸਤਿ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਾਰਸ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sant Charanaamrat Hasat Avalanb Sati , Paaras Parasi Hoi Paaras Dikhaaay Hai ?
translation: With the hands getting a touch of the feet of the True Guru, a Sikh of the Guru is seen to have become a philosopher stone like the True Guru Himself.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਰੂਪ ਸਤਿਨਾਮ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾੲੇ ਹੈ ||੨੨੬||
transliteration: Satiroop Satinaam Satigur Giaan Dhiaana , Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay Alakh Lakhaaay Hai ?226?
translation: Thus relishing the words of the Guru with all five senses and his becoming one with the True Guru, a Sikh of the Guru becomes aware of the Lord whose form and name is eternal. All this happens through the knowledge dispensed by the True Guru. (226)
